body.class: home blog custom-background site_full not_trans_header soc_pos_topfoot has_sticky_header

li.a: A Safe Place to Grow and Learn

div.p: Due to the Executive Order dated April 2, 2020 from our Governor, Gretchen Whitmer, school will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The Board of Directors meeting dated April 16, 2020 is canceled.

Though the school is closed, our Admissions Coordinator is eager to talk with families interested in learning more about our program. Please contact the Admissions Office (810) 632-5473 or email admissions@csaschool.org for more information.

Charyl Stockwell Academy District is a high performing public school district that uses state of the art instructional best practices in a K-12 school setting. The district is made up of three schools: elementary, middle and college preparatory. The academic achievement record of CSA District places it among the top performing school districts in the county and state.

div.h2: Now Enrolling for the 2020-21 School Year.
div.p: CSA District has seats available for Kindergarten through High School. Please click on the admissions link for more information about the enrollment process into CSA District Schools.

a.class: lts_button lts_button_sc lts_button_large lt_rounded lt_circular lt_flat

div.p: Providing children with learning activities that are developmentally appropriate and innovative in a wholesome setting that promotes intellectual development and moral excellence.

a.class: lts_button lts_button_sc lts_button_default lt_rounded lt_circular lt_flat

div.p: Providing adolescent students with an integrated, exploratory, and rigorous college preparatory education in a wholesome setting that promotes intellectual development and moral excellence.

a.class: lts_button lts_button_sc lts_button_default lt_rounded lt_circular lt_flat

div.p: Providing adolescent students with a rigorous and demanding college preparatory education in a wholesome setting that promotes intellectual development, moral excellence and international mindedness to create a peaceful world through intercultural understanding and respect.

a.class: lts_button lts_button_sc lts_button_default lt_rounded lt_circular lt_flat

div.p: The mission of Charyl Stockwell Academy District is to provide a safe and enriching place for children to grow from early childhood through adolescence, while providing those children with specific learning activities that allow each of them to meet and exceed academic requirements in preparation for success in college, career, and life.

CSA District is dedicated to the development of the whole child. The curriculum is intentional and comprehensive in addressing the academic/intellectual, social/emotional, moral/character, and physical development of students. The educational program includes art, music, physical education and foreign language.

CSA District has a researched theory based character education program that incorporates internal motivation psychology and the development of American civic character. All classrooms feature daily discussions of character and experience learning activities to implement the “embedded curriculum.”

CSA District is well known for its high academic achievement. The educational model emphasizes academic rigor and strong intellectual development, and includes a program for the academically gifted student. CSA District is designated as a School of Excellence by Central Michigan University and as a Reward School by the Michigan Department of Education.

CSA District provides a robust athletic program for students enrolled in later elementary through high school. The athletic program aligns with the Mission and Core Philosophies of the District and the character education program that is a central component of the K-12 educational program. CSA District Athletics is a member of MHSAA- Class D.
CSPA High School now offers International Baccalaureate (IB) Program for its upperclassmen.

a.class: lts_button lts_button_sc lts_button_default lt_rounded lt_circular lt_flat

div.p: Stay informed with highlights from our weekly District newsletter.

div.h3: “A Safe Place for Children to Grow from Childhood through Adolescence.”
